original_solution_mapping.L1: A full year has 12 months. So 2 years is 2*12 = <<2*12=24>>24 months
original_solution_mapping.L2: The loan amount is $6,000 that he will repay in 24 months so 6000/24 = $<<6000/24=250>>250 per month
original_solution_mapping.L3: If he paid his dad back in 5 years that 5*12 = <<5*12=60>>60 months
original_solution_mapping.L4: $6,000 loan spread out over 60 months is 6000/60 = $<<6000/60=100>>100 per month
original_solution_mapping.L5: To pay it off in 2 years instead of 5, Gary is paying 250-100 = $<<250-100=150>>150 more per month

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 199.
    Returns: the additional amount Gary is spending per month.
    """
    # L1
    repayment_years_short = 2 # pay him back the full amount in 2 years
    months_per_year = 12 # WK
    months_short_term = repayment_years_short * months_per_year

    # L2
    loan_amount = 6000 # Gary bought his first used car for $6,000
    monthly_payment_short_term = loan_amount / months_short_term

    # L3
    repayment_years_long = 5 # pay him back the full amount over 5 years
    months_long_term = repayment_years_long * months_per_year

    # L4
    monthly_payment_long_term = loan_amount / months_long_term

    # L5
    additional_monthly_payment = monthly_payment_short_term - monthly_payment_long_term

    # FA
    answer = additional_monthly_payment
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: A full year has {months_per_year} months. So {repayment_years_short} years is {repayment_years_short}*{months_per_year} = <<{repayment_years_short}*{months_per_year}={months_short_term}>>{months_short_term} months

The loan amount is ${loan_amount} that he will repay in {months_short_term} months so {loan_amount}/{months_short_term} = $<<{loan_amount}/{months_short_term}={monthly_payment_short_term}>>{monthly_payment_short_term} per month
If he paid his dad back in {repayment_years_long} years that {repayment_years_long}*{months_per_year} = <<{repayment_years_long}*{months_per_year}={months_long_term}>>{months_long_term} months

${loan_amount} loan spread out over {months_long_term} months is {loan_amount}/{months_long_term} = $<<{loan_amount}/{months_long_term}={monthly_payment_long_term}>>{monthly_payment_long_term} per month

To pay it off in {repayment_years_short} years instead of {repayment_years_long}, Gary is paying {monthly_payment_short_term}-{monthly_payment_long_term} = $<<{monthly_payment_short_term}-{monthly_payment_long_term}={additional_monthly_payment}>>{additional_monthly_payment} more per month

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: A full year has 12 months. So 2 years is 2*12 = <<2*12=24>>24 months
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The loan amount is $6000 that he will repay in 24 months so 6000/24 = $<<6000/24=144000>>144000 per month
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If he paid his dad back in 5 years that 5*12 = <<5*12=60>>60 months
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: $6000 loan spread out over 60 months is 6000/60 = $<<6000/60=100>>100 per month
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: To pay it off in 2 years instead of 5, Gary is paying 144000-100 = $<<144000-100=143900>>143900 more per month

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
